description: Assessment pathway for acute otitis media supporting Pharmacy First consultation and supply decisions.
inclusion: Children and adults aged 1 year and over with acute ear pain or discharge.
Symptoms present for 14 days or fewer without signs of mastoiditis or meningitis.
Able to take amoxicillin or macrolide alternatives when indicated.
exclusion: Suspected mastoiditis, facial nerve palsy, or intracranial complications.
Recurrent AOM with grommets or craniofacial abnormalities requiring ENT review.
Known immunocompromise or systemic sepsis features.
safetyNetting: Seek urgent care if swelling develops behind the ear or the ear protrudes.
Return if pain or fever worsens after 48 hours despite treatment.
Arrange GP review if symptoms persist beyond 1 week or hearing does not recover.

result.summary: Immediate medical assessment required due to red flag signs.
actions: Arrange same-day urgent care or 999 depending on severity.

actions: Arrange GP follow-up and provide analgesia advice.

outcomes.description: Immediate antibiotic criteria met with penicillin allergy

result.headline: Supply Clarithromycin for 5 days
result.summary: Severe features meet criteria for immediate antibiotic with penicillin allergy recorded.
actions: Supply Clarithromycin 250 mg twice daily for 5 days (weight-adjust paediatric dosing).
Provide analgesia advice and discuss adherence.
Give written safety-netting including escalation triggers.

supply.dosage: Take 250 mg twice daily for 5 days (child doses weight adjusted)
supply.notes: Check drug interactions (e.g., statins) before supply.

result.headline: Supply Amoxicillin for 5 days
result.summary: Severe features meet criteria for immediate antibiotic therapy.
actions: Supply Amoxicillin 500 mg three times daily for 5 days (adjust paediatric dose by weight).
Document safety-netting including escalation if symptoms worsen.

supply.product: Amoxicillin 500 mg capsules or oral suspension
supply.dosage: Take 500 mg three times daily for 5 days (paediatric dosing per weight)
supply.notes: Check for recent beta-lactam exposure or interactions.

pass.label: Offer delayed antibiotic prescription with safety netting.

result.headline: Consider delayed antibiotic prescription
result.summary: Discuss delayed prescription and provide strong safety netting.
actions: Provide delayed prescription valid for 3 days if symptoms fail to improve.
Instruct patient to commence antibiotic only if fever/pain persist or worsen.

result.headline: Self-care advice for mild acute otitis media
result.summary: Symptoms mild - provide analgesia and watchful waiting guidance.
actions: Recommend regular paracetamol or ibuprofen (if suitable).
Advise rest, fluids, and avoidance of water entry into affected ear.
Arrange follow-up if symptoms persist beyond 1 week.
safetyNet: Seek urgent care if swelling develops behind the ear or patient becomes systemically unwell.
Return if pain worsens or discharge appears.
